doc.after: Camping is a popular pastime at Colton Point State Park; 1,989Â persons have used the camping facilities in 2003.[2] With no modern amenities like flush toilets or showers, the campsites take on a rustic nature. There are outhouses, fire rings, a sanitary dump station and picnic tables at the campground. An Organized Group Tenting area, intended for organized youth or adult groups, can accommodate up to 90 campers. 1,490Â campers used the area in 2003.[2][9] The park also has approximately 100 picnic tables and five CCC-built picnic shelters which can be reserved. These facilities were used by 15,379 picnickers in 2003.[2]
